availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Julius Vaden Thomasson (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Ann Wright Thomasson in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on May 3, 1832. Married to Mary "Polly" W. Caldwell Thomasson in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on August 1, 1838. Father of Matthew W. Thomasson, Allice V. Thomasson, Sarah Ann Thomasson, Louisa J. Thomasson, James M. Thomasson, Susan C. Thomasson, Julius V. Thomasson, Nancy M. Thomasson, and John C. Thomasson. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, First District, 367B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 611.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 8, p. 530B.
Find A Grave, "Julius Vaden Thomasson (1800-1890)," Memorial #43936513, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43936513 (accessed March 30, 2017).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272805, p. 407 of 475 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
